description.narrative: Strengthening the National Capacity of the Republic of Kazakhstan to Regulate Chemicals Through Ensuring Compliance with Obligations Under International Multilateral Environmental Agreements.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Number of strengthened capacity of national government authorities and experts Number of recommendations on improvements and additions to the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan on chemical management Updated National profile Number of trained national interagencies specialists, government authouritties Number of recommendations of Working Group, accepted by Ministry of ecology, geology and natural resources Number of published articles and publications on chemical management

comment.narrative: Number of strengthened capacity of national government authorities and experts - 500 Number of recommendations on improvements and additions to the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan on chemical management - 2 Updated National profile - 1 Number of trained national interagencies specialists, government authouritties - 500 Number of recommendations of Working Group, accepted by Ministry of ecology, geology and natural resources - 1 Number of published articles and publications on chemical management -2

1.Improving National Legislation in the Sphere of Chemical Management. 2.Strengthening Institutional Capacity of the National Coordination Bodies for Chemical Management. 3. Project management, gender mainstreaming, Monitoring and Evaluation

1.The project has developed several technical clauses with respect to the hazardous wastes and embedded them into the final version of the Ecological code enacted by the Government of Kazakhstan. The particular proposals were related to the relation of the POPs articles (346, 251, 379,388, 402, 418).Two national-level legal and policy normative regulatory acts were elaborated. Both regulations are under consideration of other respective miniseries before the final enactment by the Government of Kazakhstan. These are normative acts that bring the following regulations: (1) On approval of the list of pollutants for which the issues of emissions are established ; (2) Rules for handling persistent organic pollutants and waste containing items; (3) Rules for maintaining hazardous wastes. 2.In general, during the period of the project implementation, the capacity of more than 1000 people has increased, including representatives of industrial enterprises, government agencies, NGOs. For the purpose of awareness raising on chemicals and hazardous waste information campaign is conducted on three information platforms: the UNDP website and social networks, the website and social networks of the PF “Center on Sustainable Development” and the website of the subordinate organization of the Ministry of Ecology, Geology and Natural Resources of RK JSC “Zhasyl Damu. 3.Monitoring of the project activities was carried out by the country office on a regular basis through weekly meetings, monitoring of the implementation of the budget and activities through the system of Atlas.From the side of the national partner through the participation of the national director in the working groups, workshops, trainings, project board meetings.The project addresses gender issues in the following ways: 1) the gender marker is used in accordance with UNDP guidance; 2) gender issues are incorporated into the projects results framework 3) the project will consider the proportion of women and men as direct beneficiaries.

In 2019, the following actions were planned: selection and hiring of a national expert and assistant. Development of theses assignment, selection and hiring of a company. Conducting a workshop with government officials.

At the end of 2019, a national expert was selected and hired, a project assistant was selected, a contract with the company was prepared and concluded. A working meeting was held with representatives of the Ministry of Ecology, the Ministry of Health, Jasyl Damu JSC, and NGOs.

In 2020, the following actions were planned: Component 1 1) analyses of the current legislation and gaps analyses in institutional cooperation on chemicals issues. 2) analysis of chemicals export and import. 3) analysis of the production and use of chemicals. 4) proposals for the harmonization of legislation in the field of healthcare, environmental protection, safety of chemical products, labor protection, industrial safety. 5) draft National Chemicals Profile 6) proposals for establishment of a mechanism for intersectoral coordination of chemicals management issues. Component 2 1) conduction of a workshop in Nur- Sultan to discuss a report on recommendations on problems, weaknesses and barriers in national legislation for the coordinated implementation of all chemical conventions. 2) conduction of Regional (oblast) Round Tables with various stakeholders in Pavlodar, Kostanay, Ust-Kamenogorsk, Karaganda. 3) conduction of regional trainings for stakeholders on chemicals management in Pavlodar, Kostanay, Ust-Kamenogorsk, Karaganda 4) conduction working groups meetings for coordination of chemicals management issues.
Component 4. Building capacity of medical personnel and establishment of sustainable healthcare waste management system under COVID-19 conditions Outcome 1. Harmonized regulatory standards for case treatment of medical COVID-19 waste Outcome 2: Strengthened capacity of medical professionals
